description: Create, edit and manage customer support tickets.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Unique Identifier. You can find it at Admin->Channels->API->OAuth Clients

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Secret value you received when you registered your application with Zendesk

args.name: code
args.info: Code you received from Zendesk after the user granted access

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: The same redirect URL as in received Code step.

blocks.name: getIncrementalTickets
blocks.description: Returns the tickets that changed since the start time. The results include tickets that were updated by the system. The endpoint can return records where the updated_at time is earlier than the start_date time. The reason is that the updated_at value is updated only if the ticket update generates a ticket event. Otherwise, the timestamp of the previous update carries over.

blocks.name: getIncrementalTicketsEvents
blocks.description: Returns a stream of changes that occurred on tickets. Each event is tied to an update on a ticket and contains all the fields that were updated in that change. You can include comments in the event stream by using the comment_events sideload. See Sideloading below. If you don't specify the sideload, any comment present in the ticket update is described only by Boolean comment_present and comment_public object properties in the event's child_events array. The comment itself is not included.

blocks.name: getJobStatuses
blocks.description: This shows the current statuses for background jobs running.

blocks.name: getTickets
blocks.description: Tickets are ordered chronologically by created date, from oldest to newest. The first ticket listed may not be the absolute oldest ticket in your account due to ticket archiving. To get a list of all tickets in your account, use the Incremental Ticket Export endpoint.

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Possible values are assignee, assignee.name, created_at, group, id, locale, requester, requester.name, status, subject, updated_at

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

blocks.name: getSingleTicket
blocks.description: Returns a number of ticket properties, but not the ticket comments. To get the comments, use List Comments.

blocks.name: getTicketsByIds
blocks.description: Accepts a list of ticket ids to return. This endpoint will return up to 100 tickets records.

args.name: comment
args.info: A comment object that describes the problem, incident, question, or task. todo JSON

args.name: requesterId
args.info: The numeric ID of the user asking for support through the ticket

args.name: submitterId
args.info: The numeric ID of the user submitting the ticket

args.name: assigneeId
args.info: The numeric ID of the agent to assign the ticket to

args.name: groupId
args.info: The numeric ID of the group to assign the ticket to

args.name: collaboratorIds
args.info: An array of the numeric IDs of agents or end-users to CC on the ticket. An email notification is sent to them when the ticket is created

args.name: collaborators
args.info: An array of numeric IDs, emails, or objects containing name and email properties. An email notification is sent to them when the ticket is created. Example: collaborators: [ 562, someone@example.com, { name: Someone Else, email: else@example.com } ]

args.name: type
args.info: Allowed values are problem, incident, question, or task

args.name: priority
args.info: Allowed values are urgent, high, normal, or low

args.name: status
args.info: Allowed values are new, open, pending, hold, solved or closed. Is set to new if status is not specified

args.name: tags
args.info: Comma-separated of tags to add to the ticket

args.name: externalId
args.info: An ID to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records

args.name: forumTopicId
args.info: The numeric ID of the topic the ticket originated from, if any

args.name: problemId
args.info: For tickets of type 'incident', the numeric ID of the problem the incident is linked to, if any

args.name: dueAt
args.info: For tickets of type 'task', the due date of the task. Accepts the ISO 8601 date format (yyyy-mm-dd)

args.name: ticketFormId
args.info: (Enterprise only) The id of the ticket form to render for the ticket

args.name: customFields
args.info: An array of the custom fields of the ticket. See below for details

args.name: viaFollowupSourceId
args.info: The id of a closed ticket for a follow-up ticket.

blocks.name: createTickets
blocks.description: Create many tickets from JSON file

args.name: tickets
args.info: JSON file contents array of tickets data. Example [{ticketData1}, {ticketData2}]. TicketData the same as when creating one ticket.

args.name: externalId
args.info: An id you can use to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records

args.name: type
args.info: The type of this ticket, i.e. "problem", "incident", "question" or "task"

args.name: subject
args.info: The value of the subject field for this ticket

args.name: rawSubject
args.info: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "subject" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

args.name: priority
args.info: Priority, defines the urgency with which the ticket should be addressed: "urgent", "high", "normal", "low"

args.name: recipient
args.info: The original recipient e-mail address of the ticket

args.name: requesterId
args.info: The user who requested this ticket

args.name: submitterId
args.info: The user who submitted the ticket; The submitter always becomes the author of the first comment on the ticket.

args.name: assigneeId
args.info: What agent is currently assigned to the ticket

args.name: organizationId
args.info: The organization of the requester. You can only specify the ID of an organization associated with the requester. See Organization Memberships

args.name: groupId
args.info: The group this ticket is assigned to

args.name: collaboratorIds
args.info: Who are currently CC'ed on the ticket

args.name: forumTopicId
args.info: The topic this ticket originated from, if any

args.name: problemId
args.info: The problem this incident is linked to, if any

args.name: dueAt
args.info: If this is a ticket of type "task" it has a due date. Due date format uses ISO 8601 format.

args.name: tags
args.info: The array of tags applied to this ticket

args.name: customFields
args.info: The custom fields of the ticket

args.name: ticketFormId
args.info: The id of the ticket form to render for this ticket - only applicable for enterprise accounts

args.name: brandId
args.info: The id of the brand this ticket is associated with - only applicable for enterprise accounts

blocks.name: updateTickets
blocks.description: Update tickets by its id (in each obj in list)

args.name: params
args.info: Json file with params to update. Example [param1, param2]. Each param is object like params in updateSingleTicket

blocks.name: updateTicketsByIds
blocks.description: Update many tickets with the same information

args.name: externalId
args.info: An id you can use to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records

args.name: type
args.info: The type of this ticket, i.e. "problem", "incident", "question" or "task"

args.name: subject
args.info: The value of the subject field for this ticket

args.name: rawSubject
args.info: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "subject" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

args.name: priority
args.info: Priority, defines the urgency with which the ticket should be addressed: "urgent", "high", "normal", "low"

args.name: recipient
args.info: The original recipient e-mail address of the ticket

args.name: requesterId
args.info: The user who requested this ticket

args.name: submitterId
args.info: The user who submitted the ticket; The submitter always becomes the author of the first comment on the ticket.

args.name: assigneeId
args.info: What agent is currently assigned to the ticket

args.name: organizationId
args.info: The organization of the requester. You can only specify the ID of an organization associated with the requester. See Organization Memberships

args.name: groupId
args.info: The group this ticket is assigned to

args.name: collaboratorIds
args.info: Who are currently CC'ed on the ticket

args.name: forumTopicId
args.info: The topic this ticket originated from, if any

args.name: problemId
args.info: The problem this incident is linked to, if any

args.name: dueAt
args.info: If this is a ticket of type "task" it has a due date. Due date format uses ISO 8601 format.

args.name: tags
args.info: The array of tags applied to this ticket

args.name: customFields
args.info: The custom fields of the ticket

args.name: ticketFormId
args.info: The id of the ticket form to render for this ticket - only applicable for enterprise accounts

args.name: brandId
args.info: The id of the brand this ticket is associated with - only applicable for enterprise accounts

blocks.name: markSingleTicketAsSpam
blocks.description: Mark Ticket as Spam and Suspend Requester

blocks.name: markTicketsAsSpam
blocks.description: Mark Tickets as Spam and Suspend Requester

blocks.name: mergeTickets
blocks.description: Merges one or more tickets into the {id} target ticket.

args.name: targetComment
args.info: Private comment to add to the target ticket

args.name: sourceComment
args.info: Private comment to add to the source ticket

blocks.name: autocompleteTicketsProblems
blocks.description: Returns tickets whose type is 'Problem' and whose subject contains the string specified in the text parameter.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

blocks.name: removeCommentAttachment
blocks.description: Redaction allows you to permanently remove attachments from an existing comment on a ticket. Once removed from a comment, the attachment is replaced with a placeholder 'redacted.txt' file. Note that redaction is permanent. It is not possible to undo redaction or see what was removed. Once a ticket is closed, redacting its attachments is no longer possible.

blocks.name: uploadFiles
blocks.description: Adding multiple attachments to the same upload is handled by splitting requests and passing the API token received from the first request to each subsequent request. The token is valid for 3 days. Note: Even if private attachments are enabled in the Zendesk Support instance, uploaded files are visible to any authenticated user at the content_URL specified in the JSON response until the upload token is consumed. Once an attachment is associated with a ticket or post, visibility is restricted to users with access to the ticket or post with the attachment.

args.name: uploadToken
args.info: Upload token. Use it when need to upload more then 1 file and associate with token

args.name: uploadToken
args.info: Upload token. Use it when need to upload more then 1 file and associate with token

blocks.name: getSatisfactionRatings
blocks.description: List all received satisfaction rating requests ever issued for your account.

blocks.name: createSatisfactionRating
blocks.description: Create a rating for solved tickets, or for tickets that were previously solved and then reopened.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

blocks.name: getTicketAudits
blocks.description: Lists the audits for a specified ticket.

blocks.name: getTicketSingleAudits
blocks.description: Get audit for a specified ticket by audit ID

blocks.name: removeWordFromTicketComment
blocks.description: Permanently removes words or strings from a ticket comment. Specify the string to redact in an object with a text property. Example: {"text": "credit-card-number"}. The characters of the word or string are replaced by the ▇ symbol. Redaction is permanent. You can't undo the redaction or see what was removed. Once a ticket is closed, you can no longer redact strings from its comments.

blocks.name: skipTicket
blocks.description: Record a new skip for the current user

blocks.name: getSingleMetric
blocks.description: Get ticket metric by metric ID

blocks.name: getSingleTicketMetric
blocks.description: Get ticket metric by ticket ID

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

blocks.name: getRequestListByStatus
blocks.description: Get list of requests by status

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

blocks.name: deleteMembership
blocks.description: Immediately removes a user from a group and schedules a job to unassign all working tickets that are assigned to the given user and group combination.

blocks.name: deleteMemberships
blocks.description: Immediately removes users from groups and schedules a job to unassign all working tickets that are assigned to the given user and group combinations.

args.name: groupMembershipIds
args.info: Comma-separated list of group membership ids

blocks.name: getUsersByExternalIds
blocks.description: Get Users by External Id list

args.name: externalIds
args.info: Comma-separated list of user's external ids

args.name: verified
args.info: True - if you need to create users without sending out a verification email.

args.name: role
args.info: If you need to create agents with a specific role, the role parameter only accepts three possible values: "end-user", "agent", "admin".

args.name: customRoleId
args.info: Therefore you will need to set role to "agent" as well as add a new parameter called "custom_role_id" and give it the actual desired role ID from your Zendesk Support account.

args.name: userId
args.info: This user will be merged into the existing user provided in the target user id param. Any two arbitrary users can be merged.

args.name: targetUserId
args.info: User ID to which will be merged

blocks.name: autocompleteUsers
blocks.description: Returns an array of users whose name starts with the value specified in the name paramater. It only returns users with no foreign identities.

args.name: name
args.info: The text from which the name begins

blocks.name: requestUserCreate
blocks.description: Sends the owner a reminder email to update their subscription so more agents can be created.

blocks.name: setUserPassword
blocks.description: An admin can set a user's password only if the setting is enabled under Settings > Security > Global. The setting is off by default. Only the account owner can access and change this setting in Zendesk Support.

blocks.name: updatePassword
blocks.description: You can only change your own password. Nobody can change the password of another user because it requires knowing the user's existing password. However, an admin can set a new password for another user without knowing the existing password. See "Set a User's Password" above.

blocks.name: getPasswordRequirements
blocks.description: Get a list of password requirements

blocks.name: getIdentities
blocks.description: Returns all user identities for a given user id.

blocks.name: getSingleIdentity
blocks.description: Shows the identity with the given id.

blocks.name: createIdentity
blocks.description: Adds a new identity to a user's profile. An agent can add an identity to any user profile.

args.name: type
args.info: New identity: email, twitter, facebook or google

blocks.name: createSelfIdentity
blocks.description: Add an identity to their own user profile

args.name: type
args.info: New identity: email, twitter, facebook or google

blocks.name: updateIdentity
blocks.description: This endpoint allows you to set the specified identity as verified (but you cannot unverify a verified identity and update the value of the specified identity

args.name: name
args.info: Identity name. Example: email, twitter, verified etc. You cant change primary identity value. For more details look at getIdentities

blocks.name: makeIdentityPrimary
blocks.description: Sets the specified identity as primary. Only fort Agents

blocks.name: makeMyIdentityPrimary
blocks.description: Sets the own identity as primary. For verified end users

blocks.name: verifyIdentity
blocks.description: Sets the specified identity as verified.

blocks.name: requestUserVerification
blocks.description: Sends the user a verification email with a link to verify ownership of the email address.

blocks.name: deleteIdentity
blocks.description: Deletes the identity for a given user.

blocks.name: getCustomRoles
blocks.description: Get custom roles. Available only in Enterprise plan and Professional plan with the Light Agents add-on

blocks.name: deleteAllSessions
blocks.description: Delete all session for current user

blocks.name: logout
blocks.description: Deletes the current session. In practice, this only works when using session auth for requests, such as client-side requests made from a Zendesk app. When using OAuth or basic authentication, you don't have a current session so this endpoint has no effect.

blocks.name: autocompleteOrganizations
blocks.description: Returns an array of organizations whose name starts with the value specified in the name parameter.

args.name: externalId
args.info: A unique external id to associate organizations to an external record

args.name: domainNames
args.info: An array of domain names associated with this organization

args.name: details
args.info: Any details obout the organization, such as the address

args.name: notes
args.info: Any notes you have about the organization

args.name: groupId
args.info: New tickets from users in this organization are automatically put in this group

args.name: sharedTickets
args.info: End users in this organization are able to see each other's tickets

args.name: sharedComments
args.info: End users in this organization are able to see each other's comments on tickets

args.name: organizationFields
args.info: Custom fields for this organization. Example: ["org_dropdown": "option_1", "org_decimal": 5.2]

blocks.name: createOrganizationSubscription
blocks.description: Create organization subscription. End users can only subscribe to shared organizations in which they're members.

blocks.name: getListOrganizationSubscriptions
blocks.description: Get list of all organizations and subscriptions

blocks.name: getSingleOrganizationSubscriptions
blocks.description: Get list of all single organization subscriptions

blocks.name: getUserOrganizationSubscriptions
blocks.description: Get list of all user organization subscriptions

blocks.name: getListOrganizationMemberships
blocks.description: Get list of all organization memberships

blocks.name: getUserOrganizationMemberships
blocks.description: Get list of single user memberships

blocks.name: getSingleOrganizationMemberships
blocks.description: Get list of single organization memberships

blocks.name: deleteOrganizationMembershipsByIds
blocks.description: Immediately removes a user from a organization and schedules a job to unassign all working tickets that are assigned to the given user and organization combination

args.name: membershipIds
args.info: Comma-separated list of organization membership IDs

blocks.name: searchUsersByQuery
blocks.description: Specify a partial or full name or email address as the value of the query attribute. Example: query="Gerry". Specify an id number as the value of the external_id attribute. For more advanced searches of users, use the Search API.

blocks.name: updateUsersByIds
blocks.description: Update users with the same data

args.name: userIds
args.info: List of user IDs to update same data

args.name: params
args.info: Param to be updated to all users, which ids send. Example: {"organization_id": 1}

blocks.name: updateUsersByExternalIds
blocks.description: Update users with the same data

args.name: externalIds
args.info: List of user external IDs to update same data

args.name: params
args.info: Param to be updated to all users, which ids send. Example: {"organization_id": 1}

blocks.name: updateUsers
blocks.description: Update users with the different data by id or externalId

args.name: params
args.info: Param to be updated to all users, which ids send. Example:  [{ "id": 10071, "name": "New Name", "organization_id": 1 },{ "external_id": "123", "verified": true }]. In each element in array required id or externalId.

blocks.name: updateOrganizationsByIds
blocks.description: Update organization with the same data by id

args.name: params
args.info: Param to be updated to all users, which ids send. Example: {"notes": "Something interesting"}. In each element in array required id or externalId.

blocks.name: updateOrganizationsByExternalIds
blocks.description: Update organization with the same data by external id

args.name: params
args.info: Param to be updated to all users, which ids send. Example: {"notes": "Something interesting"}. In each element in array required id or externalId.

blocks.name: updateOrganizations
blocks.description: Update organization with the different data by id or external id

args.name: params
args.info: Param to be updated to all users, which ids send. Example: [{"id": 1, "notes": "Something interesting" },{ "external_id": "2", "notes": "Something even more interesting"}]. In each element in array required id or externalId.

blocks.name: createSearchQuery
blocks.description: The search API is a unified search API that returns tickets, users, and organizations. You can define filters to narrow your search results according to resource type, dates, and object properties, such as ticket requester or tag.

args.name: commentAuthorId
args.info: Author ID of comment. If not set, system use owner of accessToken
